page.title: 15RELIGION IN CRUWYS MORCHARD
page.content: The Church of the Holy Cross (Church of England) is one of twelve in the Exe Valley group of churches cared for by a rector, two vicars and two lay readers. Services are held on Sundays, congregations are small for the size of the parish. Larger gatherings celebrate Easter, Harvest Festival and Christmas. Baptisms, marriages and funerals are conducted by arrangement. Sunday School is alternate Sundays, the children have an annual outing and a Christmas party. Pennymoor Congregational Chapel, built 1840, was reopened on 15 July 1980. Services are held the first Sunday of each month, there are no attached clergy. Alternate Thursday afternoons the Women's Fellowship meets, outings are arranged by the committee. The chapel holds an annual rally of district fellowships.
